newsitem.title: UK: Cable & Wireless shares gain on merger.
newsitem.headline: Cable & Wireless shares gain on merger.

text.p: Shares in Cable & Wireless Plc were marked higher in early trade on Tuesday after the company said it had reached agreement to merge its UK operations with Nynex CableComms Group and Bell Cablemedia.
The stock was up 16-1/2p at 457-1/2 by 0715 GMT.
The stock later climbed as high as 467p, gaining 26p and topping London's most active list.

The deal merges Mercury Communications, NYNEX CableComms Group Plc, NYNEX CableComms Group Inc, Bell Cablemedia Plc and Videotron Holdings into one integrated telecoms, information and entertainment servces group.
The merged group, to be called Cable & Wireless Communications Plc, will be listed in London and New York.
Bell Cablemedia's plan to buy the remaining shares in cable TV operator Videotron will give Cable & Wireless subsidiary Mercury Communications access to its London stronghold.
Shares in Mercury's rival British Telecommunications Plc fell 4p to 354p on competition fears shortly after the announcement. The shares were also heavily traded.

"The way Cable & Wireless is running up at the moment, some people are obviously getting very excited by the deal," said one head of sales. "But we need to wait for the analysts meeting to finish to see what can actually be achieved by it."
"It's interesting to see the whole sector lifted by this," he added. "The implied value of other cable companies has been bolstered substantially this morning.
